parts.text: {"word":"explotar","priority":"★★★","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"爆発させる、爆破する","english_definition":"to explode; to detonate; to blow up.","examples":[{"sentence":"El terrorista intentó explotar la bomba en el centro de la ciudad.","translation":"The terrorist tried to explode the bomb in the city center.","usage_notes":"This meaning refers to causing something to explode.","collocations":["explotar una bomba (to explode a bomb)","explotar un artefacto (to detonate a device)"],"synonyms":["detonar","reventar","hacer estallar"],"antonyms":["desactivar","apagar"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vi","definition":"爆発する、破裂する","english_definition":"to explode; to burst; to blow up.","examples":[{"sentence":"El globo explotó cuando lo inflamos demasiado.","translation":"The balloon exploded when we inflated it too much.","usage_notes":"This meaning refers to something exploding on its own.","collocations":["explotar un globo (a balloon explodes)","explotar una llanta (a tire explodes)"],"synonyms":["reventar","estallar","hacer explosión"],"antonyms":["desinflarse","apagarse"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"（資源、才能などを）利用する、活用する","english_definition":"to exploit; to make use of; to utilize.","examples":[{"sentence":"La empresa explotó los recursos naturales de la región sin control.","translation":"The company exploited the natural resources of the region without control.","usage_notes":"This meaning refers to making use of something, sometimes in a negative way.","collocations":["explotar recursos (to exploit resources)","explotar un talento (to exploit a talent)"],"synonyms":["aprovechar","utilizar","sacar provecho de"],"antonyms":["proteger","conservar","desperdiciar"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"（人）を搾取する、食い物にする","english_definition":"to exploit; to take advantage of someone.","examples":[{"sentence":"El jefe explotaba a sus empleados haciéndoles trabajar horas extras sin pagarles.","translation":"The boss exploited his employees by making them work overtime without paying them.","usage_notes":"This meaning refers to taking unfair advantage of someone.","collocations":["explotar a los trabajadores (to exploit workers)","explotar a los niños (to exploit children)"],"synonyms":["abusar de","sacar provecho de","manipular"],"antonyms":["proteger","ayudar","defender"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vi","definition":"（感情などが）爆発する、爆発的に広がる","english_definition":"(of emotions) to explode; to burst out; to spread rapidly.","examples":[{"sentence":"La ira de la multitud explotó tras el anuncio del veredicto.","translation":"The crowd's anger exploded after the announcement of the verdict.","usage_notes":"This meaning refers to a sudden and intense expression of emotions.","collocations":["explotar la ira (anger explodes)","explotar la alegría (joy explodes)"],"synonyms":["estallar","desbordarse","manifestarse"],"antonyms":["calmarse","disminuir","apaciguarse"]}],"etymology":{"value":"From Latin 'explodere,' meaning 'to drive out with clapping, hiss off,' from ex- 'out' + plaudere 'to clap.' The sense of bursting forth or outward release is central to the word's development.","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/eks.ploˈtaɾ/","syllables":"ex-plo-tar"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["exploto","explotas","explota","explotamos","explotáis","explotan"],"past_simple":"exploté","past_participle":"explotado","present_participle":"explotando"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Explotar' has a range of meanings, from the literal sense of causing something to explode to the figurative sense of exploiting resources or people. The context is crucial to understanding the intended meaning. The reflexive form 'explotarse' is less common but can refer to self-exploitation or overexertion.","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"Yo voy a explotar la mina con mis manos.","correct":"Yo voy a dinamitar la mina.","note":"'Explotar' in the sense of using explosives to mine is better expressed with 'dinamitar.'"},{"incorrect":"El jefe me está explotando mi paciencia.","correct":"El jefe está agotando mi paciencia.","note":"To say someone is testing your patience, use 'agotar la paciencia' instead of 'explotar la paciencia.'"}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["explotación (exploitation)","explotador (exploiter)","explosión (explosion)","explosivo (explosive)"],"phrases":["explotar una beta (to strike a vein - mining)","explotar una idea (to develop an idea)","explotar al máximo (to make the most of)"],"priority":"★★★"},"level_frequency":{"level":"B1","frequency_corpus":"High","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B1","text":"The word 'explotar' is used in various contexts, including causing an explosion, utilizing resources, or taking advantage of someone. Understanding the context is essential to determine the correct meaning.","priority":"★★★"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"La bomba explotó en el edificio.","translation":"The bomb exploded in the building.","type":"literal","meaning_category":"explosion"},{"sentence":"Es necesario explotar las energías renovables.","translation":"It is necessary to exploit renewable energies.","type":"figurative","meaning_category":"resource utilization"},{"sentence":"No permitas que te exploten en el trabajo.","translation":"Don't let them exploit you at work.","type":"figurative","meaning_category":"exploitation of people"},{"sentence":"Su popularidad explotó después de la película.","translation":"His popularity exploded after the movie.","type":"figurative","meaning_category":"sudden increase"},{"sentence":"El volcán explotó con gran fuerza.","translation":"The volcano exploded with great force.","type":"literal","meaning_category":"natural disaster"}]}
